{{cpp/title|declare_no_pointers}}
{{cpp/memory/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=memory|since=c++11|removed=c++23|
void declare_no_pointers( char *p, std::size_t n );
}}

Informs the garbage collector or leak detector that the specified memory region ({{c|n}} bytes beginning at the byte pointed to by {{c|p}}) contains no traceable pointers. If any part of the region is within an allocated object, the entire region must be contained in the same object.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to the beginning of the range}}
{{par|n|the number of bytes in the range}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
(none)

===Exceptions===
Throws nothing.

===See also===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/memory/gc/dsc undeclare_no_pointers}}
{{dsc end}}
